newsitem.title: UK: LME copper slips through support in late trading.
newsitem.headline: LME copper slips through support in late trading.

text.p: Copper slipped through its $2,350 per tonne support during Monday's evening session on the London Metal Exchange as the market corrected, traders said.
At 1900 GMT, copper was indicated at $2,337/$2,342 down from a kerb close at $2,358.
Copper peaked at $2,445 last Friday and its decline was part of a much needed shake-out after it over-reached on the upside, traders said.
The market was discouraged also by talk that China considered the price too high, even although it was know to need metal.
Aluminium edged back about $5.00 to $1,652/$1,655 while the other markets were a dollar or two off their kerb levels in quiet business.
